message.content:
Step 1. Calculate the Debt to Asset Ratio.
• From the balance sheet, Total Assets (End_amount) = 14,214,117.02.
• Total Liabilities can be computed as Total Liabilities = Total Assets – Total Owner's Equity = 14,214,117.02 – 13,835,266.51 = 378,850.51.
• Debt to Asset Ratio = Total Liabilities / Total Assets = 378,850.51 / 14,214,117.02 ≈ 0.02664, which rounds to 0.03.

Step 2. Calculate the Operating Cash Flow to Net Income Ratio.
• From the cash flow statement, the Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities = -1,028,375.55.
• From the income statement, the Net Profit = 835,266.51.
• Ratio = Operating Cash Flow / Net Profit = -1,028,375.55 / 835,266.51 ≈ -1.231, which rounds to -1.23.

Thus, the solution is:
{
  "solution": {
    "Debt to Asset Ratio": "0.03",
    "Operating Cash Flow to Net Income Ratio": "-1.23"
  }
}
